title: How to Access Archive Photos on Instagram

steps.headline: Open Instagram.
steps.description: The app icon is a camera inside a square that’s a gradient from yellow to purple. You can find this on your home screen, in the app drawer, or by searching. You cannot see your archived posts or photos from the desktop website, so you'll need to use the mobile application. Log in if prompted.

steps.headline: Tap your profile image or the silhouette .
steps.description: This is in the lower right of your screen. Your profile page will open.

steps.headline: Tap the archive icon that looks like a clock face with an arrow wrapping around it pointing counter-clockwise.
steps.description: You’ll find this in the upper right corner next to ☰. A list of your archived Stories will appear.

steps.headline: Tap the Stories Archive menu.
steps.description: A menu will expand. You can also look through all your archived Stories and save them to your phone if you want to.

steps.headline: Tap Posts Archive.
steps.description: A list of your archived posts will appear.

steps.headline: Tap an image to view it.
steps.description: The post and all its original comments will load.

text: Open Instagram. The app icon is a camera inside a square that’s a gradient from yellow to purple. You can find this on your home screen, in the app drawer, or by searching. You cannot see your archived posts or photos from the desktop website, so you'll need to use the mobile application. Log in if prompted. Tap your profile image or the silhouette . This is in the lower right of your screen. Your profile page will open. Tap the archive icon that looks like a clock face with an arrow wrapping around it pointing counter-clockwise. You’ll find this in the upper right corner next to ☰. A list of your archived Stories will appear. Tap the Stories Archive menu. A menu will expand. You can also look through all your archived Stories and save them to your phone if you want to. Tap Posts Archive. A list of your archived posts will appear. Tap an image to view it. The post and all its original comments will load.
